text:
Hi guys, I'm Laura Vitale and on this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I want to share with

you how to make my nonna's famous marinated
eggplant.
I'm going to turn my grill pan on now.

You can do this on your outdoor grill, it
would be great, but I'm just going to grill

them on the indoor grill pan and they will
be fabulous.

Now if you followed me for a while and if
you follow me on Instagram, you know every

year we go to Italy and see my family, and
if you follow me closely, then you know I

post a lot about what we eat, and no meal
in my nonna's house is complete without her
marinated eggplant.

She is known for it, we love it and I make
it as often as I can especially for gatherings,

when my family was here for Christmas, because
it's just heavenly to us.

Let me run you through the list of ingredients
and I'll show you how to make it.

You'll need some eggplant which I'll talk
about in just a minute.

Fresh parsley, I've got some hot pepper flakes,
garlic, water, red wine vinegar, light olive

oil or - she uses sunflower oil, I use light
olive oil, and then you'll need some salt.

Now, ideally, in an ideal world, I would use
beautiful small Italian eggplant, they are

very hard for me to find here in the US so
if I can find a medium, really tight eggplant,
then I use that.

If you find some that are really large and
really soft in the center, don't use that.

But this is as good as it gets and I do use
a mandolin to slice them, that way they are
all even and they're nice and thin.
So this is what you want them to look like.

About this thin, and I just sort of discard
the first one because it's all peel, and then

I continue with the rest, now these are great,
we eat this with bread, with antipasti, you

can eat them with tuna salad, like an Italian
tuna salad, you can eat this with a potato

salad, we put them in rice salad, I mean they're
good no matter what you do with them.

They're delicious and I can't wait to go back
and have her make me some fresh ones.

So I"m just going to keep slicing and then
what I'm going to do just to fit my mandolin

a little bit, I'm going to just cut a little
bit off the sides, because you see how it's

a little bit wider there and it gives my mandolin
just a little bit of a hard time.
And this is pretty much all I do.

This mandolin has seen better days but you
know what it's fine.

And then you just take some olive oil, I'm
using light olive oil, like I said, sunflower

oil which is great because in the marinade
you don't want anything too strong, you wouldn't
want to use extra virgin olive oil.

And the sunflower oil doesn't solidify in
the fridge, olive oil does but just keep it

out of the fridge for about a half an hour
before you're ready to serve and it is perfect

so you just brush some olive oil on your eggplant,
I'm going to brush them on the opposite side
too.

And I'm just going to go ahead and pop these
on the grill and just get these going.

Alright so I've got all of my eggplant grilled,
the thing I want you to keep in mind is that

you do not want to overcook your eggplant,
just cook them long enough to develop grill

marks on each side, my grill pan is on high
heat, it literally takes just seconds, not

even minutes because they are going to be
sitting in oil, and a little bit of vinegar

so they're going to sort of like cook as they
marinate and they're going to be perfection.

Here's the thing that she does that's different
than anybody else that I've ever see done
it.

And this is what makes them so delicious,
instead of just drizzling these with some

vinegar, this is what she does, she does a
half and half bath, half vinegar, red wine

vinegar, and half water, this dilutes the
vinegar a little bit and still gives you that

vinegary flavor but it's not so strong that
you feel like it's too potent and you can't

really taste anything else and now all you
do from this point forward, I'm just going

to use my hands, you just dip your grilled
eggplant into the water and vinegar mixture,

I know it sounds crazy but trust me this is
so good you do not even understand, and she's

literally famous for these and when people
try to recreate them and they don't do it

exactly the way she does it, the way I'm going
to show you today, they just don't come out
the same.
People are like what do you do that's so good?

Well you can't skip this step and you cannot
skip the step of making sure that they are

really well covered in oil and like I said
I'm using light olive oil, but she uses sunflower
oil.

So now that you've got a layer of them you
take a pinch of salt, and she doesn't salt

her eggplant before grilling them so I don't
either.

You need some salt and some pepper flakes,
a couple pieces of garlic per layer.
And then you just do a little bit of parsley.
A little bit more over here.

And then you just cover these with a layer
of oil.

And you're just going to continue to do this
until you are done with your eggplant.
About to do one last layer.
My mouth is already salivating.

Beautiful, nice, a nice sandwich, you know
a nice sandwich of these, mmm, some crusty
bread, nothing better.
Nothing better.
Last bit of salt.

Hot pepper flakes, I'm telling you it's everything
together that makes this so good, so please
don't skimp on anything.

Because otherwise it's just not going to come
out the same, if you want to make an eggplant

salad with oil and vinegar dressing do that
but then it's not my nonna's marinated eggplant.
Just saying.

And now the important thing is that you make
sure that the top of these are covered with

your oil and then at this point we are done,
because all these have to do is just get covered

and popped into the fridge for about I would
say a minimum of about 8 hours but really
overnight is even better.

And then that oil is going to be the most
delicious oil you can possibly think of.

That's going to be the end of our time because
I can't taste this now because it takes a

while for them to set and it's not going to
look any different so you're not missing out

on anything else, but follow me on Instagram
because you'll see these in my stories, you'll

and you'll see all of us go crazy for them,

because they're just the best, and then we

So let me know down below if you would like
